info.text: The default category for questions shared in context '4.3 Trigonometric Identities'.

questiontext.text:
Trigonometric identities Trigonometriske identiteter

An identity is a relation which is always true. To emphasise this the symbol ‘\(\equiv\)’ is often used rather than ‘\(=\)’. For example, \((x+1)^2\equiv x^2+2x+1\) (always true) but \((x+1)^2=0\) (only true for \(x=-1\)). En identitet er en relasjon som alltid er sann. For å understreke dette brukes ofte symbolet '\(\equiv\)' i stedet for '\(=\)'. For eksempel, \((x+1)^2\equiv x^2+2x+1\) (alltid sant) men \((x+1)^2=0\) (bare sant for \(x=- 1\)).

Key Point Nøkkelpunkt

For any value of \(\theta\) \[\sin^2\theta+\cos^2\theta\equiv1\] For enhver verdi av \(\theta\) \[\sin^2\theta+\cos^2\theta\equiv1\]

One way of proving the result in the Key Point is to use the definitions of \(\sin\theta\) and \(\cos\theta\) obtained from the circle of unit radius. En måte å bevise resultatet i nøkkelpunktet på er å bruke definisjonene av \(\sin\theta\) og \(\cos\theta\) hentet fra enhetssirkelen.

Recall that \(\cos\theta=OQ\), \(\ \sin\theta=OR=QP\). By Pythagoras’ theorem:\((OQ)^2+(QP)^2=(OP)^2=1\) Husk at \(\cos\theta=OQ\), \(\ \sin\theta=OR=QP\). Etter Pythagoras' teorem:\((OQ)^2+(QP)^2=(OP)^2=1\)

hence \(\cos^2\theta+\sin^2\theta=1.\) dermed er \(\cos^2\theta+\sin^2\theta=1.\)

We have demonstrated the Key Point using an angle \(\theta\) in the first quadrant but the result is true for any \(\theta\) i.e. it is indeed an identity. Vi har demonstrert nøkkelpunktet ved å bruke en vinkel \(\theta\) i første kvadrant, men resultatet er sant for enhver \(\theta\), dvs. det er faktisk en identitet.

Sum of angles identity Sum av vinkler

This Key Point introduces two further important identities. Dette nøkkelpunktet introduserer to viktige identiteter.

Key Point Nøkkelpunkt

\[\begin{aligned} \sin (A+B) &\equiv \sin A\cos B+\cos A\sin B \qquad \qquad (1) \\ \cos(A+B) &\equiv \cos A\cos B-\sin A\sin B \qquad \qquad (2) \end{aligned}\]

Note carefully the addition sign in \((1)\) but the subtraction sign in \((2)\). Further identities can readily be obtained from \((1)\) and \((2)\). Legg nøye merke til addisjonstegnet i \((1)\), men subtraksjonstegnet i \((2)\). Ytterligere identiteter kan lett fås fra \((1)\) og \((2)\).

Dividing \((1)\) by \((2)\) we obtain Ved å dele \((1)\) med \((2)\) får vi

\[\tan(A+B)\equiv \dfrac{\sin(A+B)}{\cos(A+B)}\equiv \dfrac{\sin A\cos B+\cos A\sin B}{\cos A\cos B-\sin A\sin B}\]

Dividing every term by \(\cos A\ \cos B\) we obtain: Ved å dele hvert ledd med \(\cos A\ \cos B\) får vi:

\[\tan (A+B)\equiv \dfrac{\tan A+\tan B}{1-\tan A\tan B}\]

Replacing \(B\) by \(-B\) in \((1)\) and \((2)\) and remembering that \(\cos (-B)\equiv \cos B\) and \(\sin(-B)\equiv -\sin B\) we find Ved å erstatte \(B\) med \(-B\) i \((1)\) og \((2)\) og huske at \(\cos (-B)\equiv \cos B\) og \( \sin(-B)\equiv -\sin B\) finner vi at

\[\begin{aligned} \sin(A-B) &\equiv \sin A\cos B-\cos A\sin B \\ \cos (A-B) &\equiv \cos A\cos B+\sin A\sin B. \end{aligned}\]

Key Point Nøkkelpunkt

\[\begin{aligned} \tan (A+B) &\equiv \dfrac{\tan A+\tan B}{1-\tan A\tan B} \\ \sin(A-B) &\equiv \sin A\cos B-\cos A\sin B \\ \cos (A-B) &\equiv \cos A\cos B+\sin A\sin B \\ \tan(A-B) &\equiv \dfrac{\tan A-\tan B}{1+\tan A\tan B} \end{aligned}\]

Example Eksempel

Amplitude modulation Amplitudemodulering

Introduction Indroduksjon

Amplitude Modulation (the AM in AM radio) is a method of sending electromagnetic signals of a certain frequency (signal frequency) at another frequency (carrier frequency) which may be better for transmission. Modulation can be represented by the multiplication together of the carrier and modulating signals. To demodulate the signal the carrier frequency must be removed from the modulated signal. Amplitudemodulering (AM i AM-radio) er en metode for å sende elektromagnetiske signaler med en bestemt frekvens (signalfrekvens) ved en annen frekvens (bærefrekvens) som kan være bedre for overføring. Modulasjon kan representeres ved multiplikasjon av bærebølgen og modulasjon signalet. For å demodulere signalet må bærefrekvensen fjernes fra det modulerte signalet.

Problems in words Problemet i ord

  1. A single frequency of \(200\ \mathrm{Hz}\) (message signal) is amplitude modulated with a carrier frequency of \(2\ \mathrm{MHz}\). Show that the modulated signal can be represented by the sum of two frequencies at \(2 \times 10^6 \pm 200\ \mathrm{Hz}\) En enkel frekvens på \(200\ \mathrm{Hz}\) (meldingssignal) er amplitudemodulert med en bærefrekvens på \(2\ \mathrm{MHz}\). Vis at det modulerte signalet kan representeres som summen av to frekvenser på \(2 \times 10^6 \pm 200\ \mathrm{Hz}\)

  2. Show that the modulated signal can be demodulated by using a locally generated carrier and applying a low-pass filter. Vis at det modulerte signalet kan demoduleres ved å bruke en lokalt generert bærebølge og et lavpassfilter.

Mathematical statement of problem Matematisk problemformulering

  1. Express the message signal as \(m=a\cos(\omega_mt)\) and the carrier as \(c=b\cos(\omega_c t)\). Uttrykk meldingssignalet som \(m=a\cos(\omega_mt)\) og bæreren som \(c=b\cos(\omega_c t)\).

    Assume that the modulation gives the product \(mc=ab\cos(\omega_ct)\cos(\omega_mt)\). Anta at moduleringen gir produktet \(mc=ab\cos(\omega_ct)\cos(\omega_mt)\).

    Use trigonometric identities to show that Bruk trigonometriske identiteter til å vise at

    \[mc=ab\cos(\omega_ct)\cos( \omega_mt)=k_1\cos((\omega_c- \omega_m)t)+k_2\cos((\omega_c+ \omega_m)t),\]

    where \(k_1\) and \(k_2\) are constants. der \(k_1\) og \(k_2\) er konstanter.

    Then substitute \( \omega_c= 2 \times 10^6 \times 2\pi \) and \( \omega_m= 200 \times 2\pi \) to calculate the two resulting frequencies. Sett deretter inn \( \omega_c= 2 \times 10^6 \times 2\pi \) og \( \omega_m= 200 \times 2\pi \) for å beregne de to resulterende frekvensene.

  2. Use trigonometric identities to show that multiplying the modulated signal by \(b\cos ( \omega_ct)\) results in the lowest frequency component of the output having a frequency equal to the original message signal. Bruk trigonometriske identiteter til å vise at multiplisering av det modulerte signalet med \(b\cos(\omega_ct)\) resulterer i at den laveste frekvenskomponenten til utgangen har en frekvens lik det opprinnelige meldingssignalet.

Mathematical analysis Matematisk analyse

  1. The message signal has a frequency of \(f_m=200\ \mathrm{Hz}\) so \( \omega_m = 2\pi f_c= 2\pi \times 200 = 400\pi \) radians per second. Meldingssignalet har en frekvens på \(f_m=200\ \mathrm{Hz}\) så \( \omega_m = 2\pi f_c= 2\pi \times 200 = 400\pi \) radianer per sekund.

    The carrier signal has a frequency of \(f_c=2 \times 10^6\ \mathrm{Hz}\). Bæresignalet har en frekvens på \(f_c=2 \times 10^6\ \mathrm{Hz}\).

    Hence \(\omega_c = 2\pi f_c=2\pi\times 2 \times10^6 = 4\times 10^6\pi\) radians per second. Dermed er \(\omega_c = 2\pi f_c=2\pi\times 2 \times10^6 = 4\times 10^6\pi\) radianer per sekund.

    So \(mc=ab\cos(4\times 10^6\pi t)\cos(400\pi t)\). Så \(mc=ab\cos(4\times 10^6\pi t)\cos(400\pi t)\).

    We know the identity Vi kjenner til identiteten

    \[\cos(A+B)+\cos(A-B)\equiv 2\cos(A)\cos(B)\]

    Rearranging gives the identity: Omorganisering gir identiteten:

    \[\cos(A)\cos(B)\equiv \frac{1}{2}(\cos(A+B)+\cos(A-B)) \tag{1}\]

    Using \((1)\) with \(A=4\times 10^6\pi t\) and \(B= 400\pi t\) gives Å bruke \((1)\) med \(A=4\times 10^6\pi t\) og \(B= 400\pi t\) får vi

    \[\begin{aligned} mc =& ab(\cos(4\times10^6\pi t)\cos (400\pi t))\\ =&\frac{1}{2}ab(\cos(4\times 10^6\pi t+400\pi t)+ \cos(4\times 10^6\pi t-400\pi t))\\ =&\frac{1}{2}ab(\cos(4000400\pi t)+\cos(3999600\pi t)). \end{aligned}\]

    So the modulated signal is the sum of two waves with angular frequency of \(4000400\)\(\pi\) and \(3999600\)\(\pi\) radians per second corresponding to frequencies of \(4000400\pi/(2\pi)\) and \(39996000\pi /(2\pi)\), that is \(2000200\ \mathrm{Hz}\) and \(1999800\ \mathrm{Hz}\), i.e. \(2 \times 10^6 \pm 200\ \mathrm{Hz}\). Så det modulerte signalet er summen av to bølger med vinkelfrekvensen \(4000400\)\(\pi\) og \(3999600\)\(\pi\) radianer per sekund som tilsvarer frekvenser på \(4000400\pi/(2\pi)\) og \(39996000\pi /(2\pi)\), det vil si \(2000200\ \mathrm{Hz}\) og \(1999800\ \mathrm{ Hz}\), altså \(2 \times 10^6 \pm 200\ \mathrm{Hz}\).

  2. Taking identity \((1)\) and multiplying through by \(\cos(A)\) gives Å ta identitet \((1)\) og multiplisere med \(\cos(A)\) får vi

    \[\cos(A)\cos(A)\cos(B)\equiv \frac{1}{2}\cos (A)(\cos(A+B)+\cos(A-B))\]

    so så

    \[\cos(A)\cos(A)\cos(B)\equiv \frac{1}{2}(\cos (A)\cos(A+B)+\cos (A)\cos(A-B)) \tag{2}\]

    Identity \((1)\) can be applied to both expressions in the right-hand side of \((2)\). In the first expression, using ‘\(A+B\)’ instead of ‘\(B\)’, gives Identitet \((1)\) kan brukes på begge uttrykkene på høyre side av \((2)\). I det første uttrykket, ved å bruke '\(A+B\)' i stedet for '\(B\)', får vi

    \[\cos(A)\cos(A+B)\equiv \frac{1}{2}(\cos(A+A+B)+\cos(A-A-B))\equiv \frac{1}{2}(\cos (2A+B)+\cos (B)),\]

    where we have used \(\cos(-B)\equiv \cos(B).\). hvor vi har brukt at \(\cos(-B)\equiv \cos(B).\).

    Similarly, in the second expression, using ‘\(A-B\)’ instead of ‘\(B\)’, gives Lignende, i det andre uttrykket, ved å bruke '\(A-B\)' i stedet for '\(B\)', får vi

    \[\cos(A)\cos(A-B)\equiv \frac{1}{2}(\cos(2A-B)+\cos(B))\]

    Together these give: Sammen gir disse:

    \[\begin{aligned} \cos(A)\cos(A)\cos(B) \equiv & \textstyle\frac{1}{4}(\cos(2A+B)+\cos(B)+\cos(2A-B)+\cos(B))\\ \equiv&\textstyle\frac{1}{2}\cos(B)+\textstyle\frac{1}{4}(\cos(2A+B)+\cos(2A-B))\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad \end{aligned}\]

    With \(A=4\times 10^6\pi t\) (carrier) and \(B=400\pi t\) (message) and substituting for the given frequencies, the modulated signal multiplied by the original carrier signal gives Med \(A=4\times 10^6\pi t\) (bærebølge) og \(B=400\pi t\) (melding) og ved å sette inn de gitte frekvensene, gir det modulerte signalet multiplisert med det opprinnelige bæresignalet

    \[ab^2\cos(4\times 10^6\pi t)\cos(4\times 10^6\pi t)\cos(400\pi t)=\] \[\frac{1}{2}ab^2\cos(2\pi\times 200t)+\frac{1}{4}ab^2(\cos(2\times 4\times10^6\pi t+400\pi t) + \cos(2\times 4\times 10^6\pi t-400\pi t))\]

    The last two terms have frequencies of \(4\times 10^6 \pm 200\ \mathrm{Hz}\) which are sufficiently high that a low-pass filter would remove them and leave only the term De to siste leddene har frekvenser på \(4\times 10^6 \pm 200\ \mathrm{Hz}\) som er tilstrekkelig høye til at et lavpassfilter vil fjerne dem og bare la det riktige leddet stå igjen

    \[ab^2\cos(2\pi\times 200 t)\]

    which is the original message signal multiplied by a constant term. som er det opprinnelige meldingssignalet multiplisert med et konstant ledd.

Interpretation Tolkning

Amplitude modulation of a single frequency message signal \((f_m)\) with a single frequency carrier signal \((f_c)\) can be shown to be equal to the sum of two cosines with frequencies \(f_c\pm f_m\). Multiplying the modulated signal by a locally generated carrier signal and applying a low-pass filter can reproduce the frequency, \(f_m\), of the message signal. Amplitudemodulasjon av et enkelt frekvensmeldingssignal \((f_m)\) med et enkelt frekvensbæresignal \((f_c)\) kan vises å være lik summen av to cosinus signaler med frekvensene \(f_c\pm f_m\). Å multiplisere det modulerte signalet med et lokalt generert bæresignal og bruke et lavpassfilter kan frekvensen, \(f_m\), til meldingssignalet reproduseres .

This is known as double side band amplitude modulation . Dette er kjent som dobbelt sidebånds amplitudemodulasjon .

Example Eksempel

Obtain expressions for \(\cos\theta\) in terms of the sine function and for \(\sin\theta\) in terms of the cosine function. Finn et uttrykk for \(\cos\theta\), avhengig av sinusfunksjonen og for \(\sin\theta\) avhengig av cosinusfunksjonen.

Solution Løsning

Using Ved hjelp av

\[\cos (A-B)\equiv \cos A\cos B+\sin A\sin B\]

with \(A=\theta,\ B=\dfrac{\pi}{2}\) we obtain og med \(A=\theta,\ B=\dfrac{\pi}{2}\) får vi

\[ \cos\left(\theta-\dfrac{\pi}{2}\right)\equiv\cos\theta\ \cos\left(\dfrac{\pi}{2}\right)+\sin\theta\ \sin \left (\dfrac{\pi}{2}\right)\equiv \cos\theta\ (0)+\sin \theta\ \]

i.e. dvs.

\[\sin\theta\equiv\cos\left(\theta-\dfrac{\pi}{2}\right)\equiv\cos\left(\dfrac{\pi}{2}-\theta\right)\]

This result explains why the graph of \(\sin\theta\) has exactly the same shape as the graph of \(\cos\theta\) but it is shifted to the right by \(\dfrac{\pi}{2}\). A similar calculation yields Dette resultatet forklarer hvorfor grafen til \(\sin\theta\) har nøyaktig samme form som grafen til \(\cos\theta\), men er forskjøvet til høyre med \(\dfrac{\pi}{2 }\). En lignende beregning gir

\[\cos\theta\equiv\sin\left(\theta+\dfrac{\pi}{2}\right).\]

Double angle formulae Doble vinkler formelen

If we put \(B=A\) in the identity \(\sin (A+B)\equiv\sin A\cos B+\cos A\sin B\) we obtain Hvis vi setter \(B=A\) i identiteten \(\sin (A+B)\equiv\sin A\cos B+\cos A\sin B\) får vi

Key Point Nøkkelpunkt

\[\sin 2A\equiv\sin A\cos A+\cos A\sin A\]

so så

\[\sin 2A\equiv 2\sin A\cos A\]

Half-angle formulae Halvvinkel formelen

If we replace \(A\) by \(\dfrac{A}{2}\) and, consequently \(2A\) by \(A\), in the double angle formula, we obtain Hvis vi erstatter \(A\) med \(\dfrac{A}{2}\) og følgelig \(2A\) med \(A\), i dobbeltvinkelformelen, får vi

\(\sin A\equiv 2\sin\left(\dfrac{A}{2}\right)\cos\left(\dfrac{A}{2}\right) \)

Similarly for the cosine: Tilsvarende for cosinus:

\(\cos A\equiv 2\cos^2\left(\dfrac{A}{2}\right)-1\)

These are examples of half-angle formulae . We can obtain a half-angle formula for \(\tan A\) as well. Replacing \(A\) by \(\dfrac{A}{2}\) and \(2A\) by \(A\) in the double angle formula for \(\tan\) we obtain: Dette er eksempler på halvvinkelformler . Vi kan også få en halvvinkelformel for \(\tan A\). Ved å erstatte \(A\) med \(\dfrac{A}{2}\) og \(2A\) med \(A\) i dobbeltvinkelformelen for \(\tan\):

\(\tan A\equiv \dfrac{2\tan\left(\dfrac{A}{2}\right)}{1-\tan^2\left(\dfrac{A}{2}\right)} \)

Other formulae, which can be obtained using the half-angle formulae and are useful for integration when trigonometric functions are present: Andre formler, som kan finnes ved å bruke halvvinkelformlene er nyttige for integrasjon av trigonometriske funksjoner:


Key Point Nøkkelpunkt

If \(t= \tan\left(\dfrac{A}{2}\right)\) then Hvis \(t= \tan\left(\dfrac{A}{2}\right)\) så er
\(\sin A= \dfrac{2t}{1+t^2}\)
\(\cos A= \dfrac{1-t^2}{1+t^2}\)
\(\tan A= \dfrac{2t}{1-t^2}\)

Sum of two sines and sum of two cosines Summen av to sinuser og av to cosinuser

Here we obtain results that are widely used in areas of science and engineering such as vibration theory, wave theory and electric circuit theory. Her får vi resultater som er mye brukt innen vitenskap og ingeniørfag som vibrasjonsteori, bølgeteori og elektrisk kretsteori.

We return to the identities angle addition formulae: Vi går tilbake til addisjonsformlene for vinkeler:

\[\begin{aligned} \sin(A+B ) &\equiv \sin A\cos B+\cos A\sin B\\ \sin (A-B) &\equiv \sin A\cos B-\cos A\sin B \end{aligned}\]

Adding these identities gives Å legge sammen disse identitetene gir

\[\sin(A+B)+\sin(A-B)\equiv 2\sin A\cos B.\]

Subtracting the identities produces Å trekke fra identitetene gir

\[\sin (A+B)-\sin(A-B)\equiv 2\cos A\sin B\]

It is now convenient to let \(C=A+B\) and \(D=A-B\) so that Det er nå praktisk å la \(C=A+B\) og \(D=A-B\) slik at

\[A=\dfrac{C+D}{2} \qquad \text{and} \qquad B=\dfrac{C-D}{2}\] \[A=\dfrac{C+D}{2} \qquad \text{og} \qquad B=\dfrac{C-D}{2}\]

The above then becomes: Det ovenstående blir da:

\[\sin C+\sin D\equiv 2\sin\left(\dfrac{C+D}{2}\right)\cos \left(\dfrac{C-D}{2}\right) \]

Similarly: På samme måte:

\[\sin C-\sin D\equiv 2\cos\left(\dfrac{C+D}{2}\right)\sin \left(\dfrac{C-D}{2}\right) \]

Summary Oppsummering

We have covered a large number of trigonometric identities. The most important of them and probably the ones most worth memorising are given in the following Key Point. Vi har dekket et stort antall trigonometriske identiteter. De viktigste av dem og sannsynligvis de som er mest verdt å huske er gitt i følgende nøkkelpunkt.

Key Point Nøkkelpunkt

\[\begin{aligned} \cos^2\theta+\sin^2\theta&\equiv 1\\ \sin 2\theta&\equiv 2\sin\theta\cos\theta\\ \cos 2\theta&\equiv \cos^2\theta-\sin^2\theta\\ &\equiv 2\cos^2\theta -1\\ &\equiv 1-2\sin^2\theta\\ \sin (A\pm B)&\equiv \sin A\cos B\pm\cos A\sin B\\ \cos (A\pm B)&\equiv \cos A\cos B\mp\sin A\sin B \end{aligned}\]

Exercise

Express \( \cos^4A-\sin^4 A\) as a function of \(\cos(2A)\)

\( \cos^4A-\sin^4 A=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Solution

\[\begin{eqnarray*}\cos^4 A-\sin^4 A\equiv (\cos A)^4-(\sin A)^4 &\equiv &(\cos^2A)^2-(\sin^2A)^2\\ &\equiv &(\cos^2A-\sin^2A)(\cos^2A+\sin^2A)\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\\ &\equiv &\cos^2A-\sin^2A\equiv \cos 2A\end{eqnarray*}\]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: Your answer is not equivalent to \( \cos^4A-\sin^4 A\)
You need to simplify fully in terms of \(\cos(2A)\)

questiontext.text:
Exercise

By writing \(\cos 4x\) as \(\cos 2(2x)\), or otherwise, express \(\cos 4x\) in terms of \(\cos x\).

\(\cos 4x =\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Solution

\(\begin{eqnarray*}\cos 4x=\cos 2(2x)&\equiv &2\cos^2(2x)-1\\ &\equiv &2 (\cos 2x)^2-1\\ &\equiv &2(2\cos^2 x-1)^2-1\\ &\equiv &2(4\cos^4 x-4\cos^2 x+1)-1\equiv 8\cos^4 x-8\cos^2 x+1 \end{eqnarray*}\)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: Your answer is not equivalent to \(\cos4x\)
Your answer can be simplified.

name.text: (Unused) fraction of sum of sines and sum of cosines

questiontext.text:
Exercise

Express \(\dfrac{\sin 4\theta+\sin 2 \theta}{\cos 4 \theta+\cos 2\theta}\) as a function of \( \tan(3\theta) \)

[[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Solution

\( \dfrac{\sin 4\theta+\sin 2\theta}{\cos 4\theta+\cos 2 \theta}\equiv \dfrac{2\sin 3\theta\cos\theta}{2\cos3\theta\cos\theta} \equiv \dfrac{\sin 3\theta}{\cos 3\theta}\equiv \tan 3\theta \)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: Your answer is not equivalent to \(\dfrac{\sin 4\theta+\sin 2 \theta}{\cos 4 \theta+\cos 2\theta}\)
You can simplify your answer further in terms of \( \tan(3\theta) \)

questiontext.text:
Exercise

Express \(\dfrac{1}{\tan \theta + \cot \theta}\) as a function of \(\sin(2 \theta)\):

\(\dfrac{1}{\tan \theta + \cot \theta}=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Solution

\(\dfrac{1}{\tan\theta+\cos\theta}\equiv \dfrac{1}{\dfrac{\sin\theta}{\cos\theta} +\dfrac{\cos\theta}{\sin\theta}}\equiv \dfrac{1}{\dfrac{\sin^2\theta+\cos^2\theta}{\sin\theta\cos\theta}}\equiv \dfrac{\sin\theta\cos\theta}{\sin^2\theta+\cos^2\theta}\equiv \sin\theta\cos\theta\equiv \dfrac{1}{2}\sin 2\theta\)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: Your answer is not equivalent to \(\dfrac{1}{\tan \theta + \cot \theta}\)
Your answer can be simplified.

questiontext.text:
Exercise

Express \((1+\sin t)(1+ \sin(-t))\) as a function of just \(\cos t\):

\((1+\sin t)(1+ \sin(-t))=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Solution

\((1+\sin t)(1+\sin (-t))\equiv (1+\sin t)(1-\sin t)\equiv 1-\sin^2t\equiv \cos^2t\)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: Your answer is not equivalent to \((1+\sin t)(1+ \sin(-t))\)
Your answer can be reduced.

name.text: (Unused) product of cosines as sum of cosines

questiontext.text:
Exercise

Express \({@expr@}\) as the sum (or difference) of two cosines.

\({@expr@}=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Solution

Using \(\cos A+\cos B\equiv 2\cos \left(\dfrac{A+B}{2}\right)\cos\left(\dfrac{A-B}{2}\right)\). Clearly here \(\dfrac{A+B}{2}={@a1*x@}\), \(\dfrac{A-B}{2}={@b1*x@}\) giving \(A={@A1*x@}\), \(B={@B1*x@}\)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: Your answer can be simplified.

questiontext.text:
Exercise

Express \(\dfrac{2\tan t}{2-\sec^2 t}\) as \(\tan(nt)\) for some integer \(n\).

\(\dfrac{2\tan t}{2-\sec^2 t}=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Solution

\(\dfrac{2\tan t}{2-{\rm sec}^2t} \equiv \dfrac{2\tan t}{1-({\rm sec}^2t-1)}\equiv \dfrac{2\tan t}{1-\tan^2t}\equiv \tan 2t \)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

Using the exact values, evaluate \(\sin^2 \theta + \cos^2 \theta\) for the following angles: Bruk de eksakte verdiene, evaluer \(\sin^2 \theta + \cos^2 \theta\) for følgende vinkler:

  1. For \(\theta = \displaystyle{{@a1@}}\),   \(\sin^2 \theta + \cos^2 \theta =\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

  2. For \(\theta = \displaystyle{{@a2@}}\),   \(\sin^2 \theta + \cos^2 \theta=\) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]

  3. For \(\theta = \displaystyle{{@a3@}}\),   \(\sin^2 \theta + \cos^2 \theta =\) [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] [[feedback:prt3]]

generalfeedback.text:
Using a table or otherwise, we can find the exact values of \(\sin \theta\) and \(\cos \theta\) for each of these angles. Ved å bruke en tabell eller på en annen måte kan vi finne de eksakte verdiene til \(\sin \theta\) og \(\cos \theta\) for hver av disse vinklene.

  1. For \(\theta = {@a1@}\), we have \(\sin\theta = {@sin(a1)@}\) and \(\cos\theta = {@cos(a1)@}\). Then For \(\theta = {@a1@}\), har vi \(\sin\theta = {@sin(a1)@}\) og \(\cos\theta = {@cos(a1)@}\) så

    \[\sin^2 \theta + \cos^2 \theta = \left({@sin(a1)@}\right)^2 + \left({@cos(a1)@}\right)^2 = 1.\]

  2. For \(\theta = {@a2@}\), we have \(\sin\theta = {@sin(a2)@}\) and \(\cos\theta = {@cos(a2)@}\). Then For \(\theta = {@a2@}\), har vi \(\sin\theta = {@sin(a2)@}\) og \(\cos\theta = {@cos(a2)@}\) så

    \[\sin^2 \theta + \cos^2 \theta = \left({@sin(a2)@}\right)^2 + \left({@cos(a2)@}\right)^2 = 1.\]

  3. For \(\theta = {@a3@}\), we have \(\sin\theta = {@sin(a3)@}\) and \(\cos\theta = {@cos(a3)@}\). Then For \(\theta = {@a3@}\), har vi \(\sin\theta = {@sin(a3)@}\) og \(\cos\theta = {@cos(a3)@}\) så

    \[\sin^2 \theta + \cos^2 \theta = \left({@sin(a3)@}\right)^2 + \left({@cos(a3)@}\right)^2 = 1.\]

questionvariables.text: [a1, a2, a3] : rand_selection([pi/6, pi/4, pi/3, pi/2, 2*pi/3, 3*pi/4, 5*pi/6],3); ta1 : 1;

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

  1. Dividing the identity \(\sin^2\theta + \cos^2\theta\) by \(\sin^2\theta\), obtain an expression for \(\csc^2 \theta\) in terms of \(\cot \theta\). Ved å dele identiteten \(\sin^2\theta + \cos^2\theta\) med \(\sin^2\theta\), finn et uttrykk for \(\csc^2 \theta\) i form av \(\cot \theta\).

    \(\csc^2 \theta=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

  2. Dividing the identity \(\sin^2\theta + \cos^2\theta\) by \(\cos^2\theta\), obtain an expression for \(\sec^2\theta\) in terms of \(\tan\theta\). Ved å dele identiteten \(\sin^2\theta + \cos^2\theta\) med \(\cos^2\theta\), finn et uttrykk for \(\sec^2\theta\) i form av \(\tan\theta\).

    \(\sec^2 \theta=\) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]

generalfeedback.text:
1. \( \dfrac{\sin^2\theta}{\sin^2\theta}+\dfrac{\cos^2\theta}{\sin^2\theta}=\dfrac{1}{\sin^2\theta}\) and thus \(1+\ {\rm cot}^2\theta\equiv{\rm cosec}^2\theta\) \( \dfrac{\sin^2\theta}{\sin^2\theta}+\dfrac{\cos^2\theta}{\sin^2\theta}=\dfrac{1}{\sin^2\theta}\) så \(1+\ {\rm cot}^2\theta\equiv{\rm cosec}^2\theta\)

  2. \(\dfrac{\sin^2\theta}{\cos^2\theta}+\dfrac{\cos^2\theta}{\cos^2\theta}=\dfrac{1}{\cos^2\theta}\) and thus \(\tan^2\theta+1\equiv{\rm sec}^2\theta\) \(\dfrac{\sin^2\theta}{\cos^2\theta}+\dfrac{\cos^2\theta}{\cos^2\theta}=\dfrac{1}{\cos^2\theta}\) så \(\tan^2\theta+1\equiv{\rm sec}^2\theta\)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: Your answer is not equivalent to the expression \(\sin^2\theta + \cos^2\theta = 1\) Svaret ditt tilsvarer ikke uttrykket \(\sin^2\theta + \cos^2\theta = 1\)
Correct, but there is a simpler identity. Riktig, men det er en enklere identitet.
Your answer is not equivalent to the expression \(\sin^2\theta + \cos^2\theta = 1\) Svaret ditt tilsvarer ikke uttrykket \(\sin^2\theta + \cos^2\theta = 1\)
Correct, but there is a simpler identity. Riktig, men det er en enklere identitet.

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

Using the identities Bruke identitetene

\[\begin{aligned} \sin (A-B) &\equiv \sin A\cos B-\cos A\sin B \\ \cos (A -B) &\equiv \cos A\cos B +\sin A\sin B, \end{aligned}\]

obtain an expansion for \(\tan (A-B)\) in terms of \(\tan A\) and \(\tan B\): finn en utvidelse for \(\tan (A-B)\) i form av \(\tan A\) og \(\tan B\):

\(\tan (A-B) =\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
We have Vi har

\[\tan(A-B) \equiv \frac{\sin(A - B)}{\cos(A - B)} \equiv \dfrac{\sin A\cos B-\cos A\sin B}{\cos A\cos B+\sin A\sin B}.\]

Dividing every term by \(\cos A\ \cos B\) gives Å dele hvert ledd med \(\cos A\ \cos B\) gir

\[\tan(A-B)\equiv \dfrac{\tan A-\tan B}{1+\tan A\tan B}.\]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: Your answer is not equivalent to \(\tan (A-B)\) Svaret ditt tilsvarer ikke \(\tan (A-B)\)
Your solution can be simplified. Løsningen din kan forenkles.

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

  1. Substitute \(B = A\) in Sett \(B = A\) inn i

    \[\cos(A + B) = \cos A \cos B - \sin A \sin B\]

    to obtain an identity for \(\cos 2A\) in terms of \(\cos A\) and \(\sin A\). for å få en identitet for \(\cos 2A\) i form av \(\cos A\) og \(\sin A\).

    \(\cos(2A)=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

  2. Using \(\sin^2 A + \cos^2 A \equiv 1\), find an expression involving only \(\cos A\). Ved hjelp av \(\sin^2 A + \cos^2 A \equiv 1\), finn et uttrykk som bare involverer \(\cos A\).

    \(\cos(2A)=\) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]

  3. Now use \(\sin^2 A + \cos^2 A \equiv 1\), to find an expression involving only \(\sin A\). Bruk nå \(\sin^2 A + \cos^2 A \equiv 1\), for å finne et uttrykk som bare involverer \(\sin A\).

    \(\cos(2A)=\) [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] [[feedback:prt3]]

generalfeedback.text:
1. We are given the identity \(\cos(A + B) = \cos A \cos B - \sin A \sin B\). By substituting \(B=A\) we get: Vi får identiteten \(\cos(A + B) = \cos A \cos B - \sin A \sin B\). Ved å sette inn \(B=A\) får vi:

    \(\cos(2A)\equiv (\cos A)(\cos A)-(\sin A)(\sin A) = \cos^2 A - \sin^2 A.\)

  2. By using \(\sin^2 A + \cos^2 A \equiv 1\) we get: Ved å bruke \(\sin^2 A + \cos^2 A \equiv 1\) får vi:

    \(\cos2A \equiv \cos^2A-(1-\cos^2A) \equiv 2\cos^2A-1.\)

  3. \(\cos2A \equiv (1-\sin^{2}A)-\sin^2A \equiv 1-2\sin^2A.\)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: Your answer is not equivalent to \(\cos 2A\) Svaret ditt tilsvarer ikke \(\cos 2A\)
You can simplify further. Du kan forenkle ytterligere.
Your answer is not equivalent to \(\cos 2A\) Svaret ditt tilsvarer ikke \(\cos 2A\)
You can simplify further. Du kan forenkle ytterligere.
Your answer is not equivalent to \(\cos 2A\) Svaret ditt tilsvarer ikke \(\cos 2A\)
You can simplify further. Du kan forenkle ytterligere.

name.text: 4.3.3.4 cos squared in terms of double angle

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

Use \(\cos(2A) = 2\cos^2A-1\) and \(\cos(2A) = 1- 2\sin^2 A \) to write \(\cos^2 A\) and \(\sin^2(A)\) in terms of \(\cos(2A)\). Bruk \(\cos(2A) = 2\cos^2A-1\) og \(\cos(2A) = 1- 2\sin^2 A \) til å skrive \(\cos^2 A\) og \(\sin^2(A)\) i form av \(\cos(2A)\).

  1. \(\cos^2 A =\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

  2. \(\sin^2 A =\) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]

generalfeedback.text:
1. \(\cos(2A) = 2 \cos^2 A - 1\) so \(\cos^2 A = \dfrac{1}{2}(1+\cos(2A))\) \(\cos(2A) = 2 \cos^2 A - 1\) så \(\cos^2 A = \dfrac{1}{2}(1+\cos(2A))\)

  2. \(\cos(2A) = 1 - 2\sin^2 A\) so \(\sin^2 A = \dfrac{1}{2}(1-\cos(2A))\) \(\cos(2A) = 1 - 2\sin^2 A\) så \(\sin^2 A = \dfrac{1}{2}(1-\cos(2A))\)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: Your answer is not equivalent to \(\cos^2 A\) Svaret ditt tilsvarer ikke \(\cos^2 A\)
Your answer can be simplified. Svaret ditt kan forenkles.
Your answer is not equivalent to \(\sin^2 A\) Svaret ditt tilsvarer ikke \(\sin^2 A\)
Your answer can be simplified. Svaret ditt kan forenkles.

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

Use the double angle formulae for \(\sin(2A)\) and \(\cos(2A)\) to obtain an expression for \(\tan(2A)\) in terms of \(\tan A\). Bruk dobbeltvinkelformlene for \(\sin(2A)\) og \(\cos(2A)\) til å få et uttrykk for \(\tan(2A)\) i form av \(\tan A\).

\(\tan 2A =\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
\[\tan 2A\equiv \dfrac{\sin 2A}{\cos 2A}\equiv \dfrac{2\sin A\cos A}{\cos^2A-\sin^2A}\]

Dividing the numerator and denominator by \(\cos^2 A\) we obtain: Ved å dele telleren og nevneren med \(\cos^2 A\) får vi:

\[ \tan 2A\equiv \dfrac{2\dfrac{\sin A}{\cos A}}{1-\dfrac{\sin^2A}{\cos^2A}}\equiv \dfrac{2\tan A}{1-\tan^2A} \]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: Your answer is not equivalent to \(\tan(2A)\) Svaret ditt tilsvarer ikke \(\tan(2A)\)
Your answer can be simplified. Svaret ditt kan forenkles.

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

Use \(\cos (A\pm B) \equiv \cos A\cos B\mp\sin A\sin B\) to write: Bruk \(\cos (A\pm B) \equiv \cos A\cos B\mp\sin A\sin B\) til å skrive:

  1. \(\cos C + \cos D\) as a product of cosines. \(\cos C + \cos D\) som et produkt av cosinuser.

    \(\cos C + \cos D=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

  2. \(\cos C - \cos D\) as a product of sines. \(\cos C - \cos D\) som et produkt of sinuser.

    \(\cos C - \cos D=\) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]

generalfeedback.text:
We are given: Vi har:

\[\begin{aligned} \cos(A+B) &\equiv \cos A\cos B -\sin A\sin B \\ \cos(A-B) &\equiv \cos A\cos B+\sin A\sin B \end{aligned}\]

We can add and subtract these two equations to get: Vi kan addere og subtrahere disse to ligningene for å få:

\[\begin{aligned} \cos(A+B)+\cos (A-B)&\equiv 2\cos A\cos B\\ \cos (A+B)-\cos (A-B)&\equiv -2\sin A\sin B \end{aligned}\]

Hence with \(C=A+B\) and \(D=A-B\), Med \(C=A+B\) og \(D=A-B\) blir det:

\[\cos C+\cos D\equiv 2\cos\left(\dfrac{C+D}{2}\right)\cos \left(\dfrac{C-D}{2}\right) \] \[\cos C-\cos D\equiv -2\sin\left(\dfrac{C+D}{2}\right)\sin\left(\dfrac{C-D}{2}\right)\]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: Your answer is not equivalent to \(\cos C + \cos D\) Svaret ditt tilsvarer ikke \(\cos C + \cos D\)
Your answer can be simplified. Svaret ditt kan forenkles.
Your answer is not equivalent to \(\cos C - \cos D\) Svaret ditt tilsvarer ikke \(\cos C - \cos D\)
Your answer can be simplified. Svaret ditt kan forenkles.

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

A projectile is fired from the ground with an initial speed \(u\ \mathrm{ms}^{-1}\) at an angle of elevation \(\alpha^\circ\). If air resistance is neglected, the vertical height, \(y\ \mathrm{m}\), is related to the horizontal distance, \(x\ \mathrm{m}\), by the equation Et prosjektil skytes fra bakken med en starthastighet \(u\ \mathrm{ms}^{-1}\) og vinkel på \(\alpha^\circ\). Hvis luftmotstanden neglisjeres, er den vertikale høyden, \(y\ \mathrm{m}\), relatert til den horisontale avstanden, \(x\ \mathrm{m}\), gitt ved ligningen

\[y= x\tan\alpha -\dfrac{gx^2{\rm sec}^2\alpha}{2u^2},\]

where \(g\ \mathrm{ms^{-2}}\) is the gravitational constant. hvor \(g\ \mathrm{ms^{-2}}\) er gravitasjonskonstanten.

  1. Find the height of the projectile when it has not yet travelled any horizontal distance. Finn høyden på prosjektilet når det ennå ikke har tilbakelagt noen horisontal avstand.

    \(y(x=0) = \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

  2. For what value of \(x\) other than \(x=0\) do we have \(y=0\)? For hvilken verdi av \(x\) annet enn \(x=0\) har vi \(y=0\)?

    Simplify your answer to get a function of \(\sin(2\alpha)\). Forenkle svaret ditt for å få en funksjon av \(\sin(2\alpha)\).

    \(x=\) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]

  3. Find the value \(x_\text{max}\) for which the value of \(y\) would be a maximum. Finn verdien \(x_\text{maks}\) som gir størst \(y\)-verdi.

    Simplify your answer to get a function of \(\sin(2\alpha)\). Forenkle svaret ditt for å få en funksjon av \(\sin(2\alpha)\).

    \(x_\text{max}=\) [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] [[feedback:prt3]]

  4. Simplify the expression for the maximum height to obtain a function of \(\sin \alpha\). Forenkle uttrykket for maksimal høyde for å få en funksjon av \(\sin \alpha\).

    \(y_\text{max} =\) [[input:ans4]] [[validation:ans4]] [[feedback:prt4]]

  5. Assuming \(u = {@u1@}\ \mathrm{ms}^{-1}\), \(\alpha = {@a1@}^{\circ}\) and \(g = 10\ \mathrm{ms}^{-2}\), find the two values \(x_1 \le x_2\) of \(x\) such that \(y = \displaystyle{{@y1@}}\). Forutsatt \(u = {@u1@}\ \mathrm{ms}^{-1}\), \(\alpha = {@a1@}^{\circ}\) og \(g = 10\ \mathrm {ms}^{-2}\), finn de to verdiene \(x_1 \le x_2\) av \(x\) slik at \(y = \displaystyle{{@y1@}}\).

    Give your answer with three significant figures. Gi svaret ditt med tre signifikante sifre.

    \(x_1=\) [[input:ans5]] [[validation:ans5]] [[feedback:prt5]] and og \(x_2=\) [[input:ans6]] [[validation:ans6]] [[feedback:prt6]]

generalfeedback.text:
1. Since \(x\) appears in both of the terms on the right-hand side, when \(x=0\), the right-hand side is zero. Hence, \(y(x = 0) = 0\). Siden \(x\) er tilstede i begge leddene på høyre side er høyre side null når \(x=0\). Derfor er \(y(x = 0) = 0\).

  2. When \(y=0\), the equation can be written as Når \(y=0\), kan ligningen skrives som

    \[\dfrac{gx^2{\sec}^2\alpha}{2u^2}-x\tan\alpha=0.\]

    If \(x=0\) is excluded from consideration, we can divide through by \(x\) and rearrange to give Hvis vi antar at \(x\neq 0\), kan vi dele med \(x\) og omorganisere for å få

    \[\dfrac{gx{\sec}^2\alpha}{2u^2}=\tan\alpha.\]

    To solve for \(x\) we need to multiply both sides by \(2u^2/g{\sec}^2\alpha\). Given that For å løse for \(x\) må vi multiplisere begge sider med \(2u^2/g{\sec}^2\alpha\). Gitt at

    \[\begin{aligned} \frac{1}{\sec^2\alpha} &\equiv \cos^2 \alpha, \\ \tan \alpha &\equiv \sin\alpha \cos \alpha, \\ \sin 2 \alpha &\equiv 2\sin\alpha \cos \alpha, \end{aligned}\]

    this results in dette resulterer med

    \[x=\dfrac{2u^2\sin\alpha\cos\alpha}{g}=\dfrac{u^2\sin 2\alpha}{g}\]

    This represents the maximum range. Dette representerer maksimal rekkevidde.

  3. As air resistance is neglected, the path of the projectile is a parabola, which is symmetrical about the vertical line through its highest point. Therefore, the maximum height will occur at half the maximum range, i.e. where Ettersom luftmotstanden blir neglisjert, er banen til prosjektilet en parabel, som er symmetrisk om den vertikale linjen gjennom det høyeste punktet. Derfor vil den maksimale høyden inntreffe ved halve maksimale rekkevidden, dvs. hvor

    \[x=\dfrac{u^2\sin 2\alpha}{2g}.\]

  4. Substituting this expression for \(x\) in the equation for \(y\) gives Å erstatte dette uttrykket med \(x\) i ligningen for \(y\) gir

    \[y=\left(\dfrac{u^2\sin2\alpha}{2g}\right)\tan\alpha-\left(\dfrac{u^2\sin2\alpha}{2g}\right)^2\dfrac{g{\sec}^2\alpha}{2u^2}.\]

    Using the same trigonometric identities as before, Ved å bruke de samme trigonometriske identitetene som før får vi,

    \[\qquad y=\dfrac{u^2\sin^2\alpha}{g}-\dfrac{u^2\sin^2\alpha}{2g}=\dfrac{u^2\sin^2\alpha}{2g}.\]

    This represents the maximum height. Dette representerer maksimal høyde.

  5. Substitution of \(u={@u1@}\), \(\alpha={@a1@}\), \(g=10\) and \(y={@y1@}\) in the original equation gives a quadratic: Substitusjon av \(u={@u1@}\), \(\alpha={@a1@}\), \(g=10\) og \(y={@y1@}\) i den opprinnelige ligningen gir et kvadrat:

    \[{@eq@} = 0\]

    Solving this quadratic yields \(x_1 = {@ta5@}\) and \(x_2 = {@ta6@}\) as the two horizontal ranges at which \(y = {@y1@}\). Løsning av dette kvadratet gir \(x_1 = {@ta5@}\) og \(x_2 = {@ta6@}\) som de to horisontale områdene der \(y = {@y1@}\).

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: Your answer can be simplified. Svaret ditt kan forenkles.
Your answer can be simplified. Svaret ditt kan forenkles.
Your answer can be simplified. Svaret ditt kan forenkles.

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

Reduce the expression \( \sin t \sec t\) to a formula just involving \(\tan t\). Reduser uttrykket \( \sin t \sec t\) til en formel som bare involverer \(\tan t\).

\( \sin t \sec t =\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Recall that \(\sec t \equiv 1/\cos t\) and \(\tan t \equiv \sin t / \cos t\). Then Husk at \(\sec t \equiv 1/\cos t\) og \(\tan t \equiv \sin t / \cos t\). Da gjelder

\[\sin t \sec t \equiv \sin t \dfrac{1}{\cos t} \equiv \dfrac{\sin t}{\cos t}\equiv \tan t.\]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: Your answer is not equivalent to \( \sin t \sec t\) Svaret ditt tilsvarer ikke \( \sin t \sec t\)
Your answer can be simplified. Svaret ditt kan forenkles.

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

Express \(\sin^2(A+B)-\sin^2(A-B)\) as a function of just \(\sin(2A)\) and \(\sin(2B)\). Uttrykk \(\sin^2(A+B)-\sin^2(A-B)\) som en funksjon av bare \(\sin(2A)\) og \(\sin(2B)\).

(Hint: the left-hand side is the difference of two squared quantities.) (Tips: venstre side er differeansen på to kvadrater.)

\(\sin^2(A+B)-\sin^2(A-B)=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Using the hint and the identity \(x^2-y^2\equiv (x-y)(x+y)\) we have Ved å bruke hintet og identiteten \(x^2-y^2\equiv (x-y)(x+y)\) har vi

\[\sin^2(A+B)-\sin^2(A-B)\equiv (\sin(A+B)-\sin(A-B))(\sin (A+B)+\sin (A-B)).\]

The first bracket gives Den første parantesen gir

\[\sin A\cos B+\cos A\sin B-(\sin A\cos B-\cos A\sin B)\equiv 2\cos A\sin B.\]

Similarly the second bracket gives \(2\sin A\cos B\). På samme måte gir den andre parentesen \(2\sin A\cos B\).

Multiplying we obtain Med multiplisering får vi

\[(2\cos A\sin A)(2\cos B\sin B)\equiv \sin 2A \sin 2B.\]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: Your answer is not equivalent to \(\sin^2(A+B)-\sin^2(A-B)\) Svaret ditt tilsvarer ikke \(\sin^2(A+B)-\sin^2(A-B)\)
Your answer can be simplified. Svaret ditt kan forenkles.

name.text: 4.3.5.3 product of sines as sum of sines (NOT IN QUIZ)

questiontext.text:
Exercise

Express \(\sin({@a1*x@})\cos({@b1*x@})\) as the sum (or difference) of two sines.

\(\sin({@a1*x@})\cos({@b1*x@})=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
We use

\[\sin A+\sin B\equiv 2\sin \left(\dfrac{A+B}{2}\right)\cos\left(\dfrac{A-B}{2}\right).\]

Clearly here \(\dfrac{A+B}{2}={@a1*x@}\), \(\dfrac{A-B}{2}={@b1*x@}\) giving \(A={@A1*x@}\), \(B={@B1*x@}\).

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: Your answer is not equivalent to \(\sin({@a1*x@})\cos({@b1*x@})\)
Your answer can be simplified.

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

  1. Express \(\sin(3t)\) in terms of \(\sin t\). Uttrykk \(\sin(3t)\) i form av \(\sin t\).

    \(\sin(3t) =\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

  2. Express \(\cos(3t)\) in terms of \(\cos t\). Uttrykk \(\cos(3t)\) i form av \(\cos t\).

    \(\cos(3t)=\) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]][[feedback:prt2]]

generalfeedback.text:
1. We use the sum and double angle formulas. Vi bruker sum- og dobbelvinkelformlene.

    \[\begin{aligned} \sin 3\theta &\equiv \sin (2\theta+\theta)=\sin 2\theta\cos\theta+\cos 2\theta\sin\theta \\ &\equiv 2\sin\theta\cos^2\theta+(\cos^2\theta-\sin^2\theta)\sin\theta\\ &\equiv 3\sin\theta\cos^2\theta-\sin^3\theta\\ &\equiv 3\sin\theta(1-\sin^2\theta)-\sin^3\theta\equiv 3\sin\theta-4\sin^3\theta \end{aligned}\]

  2. We proceed simiarly. Vi fortsetter på samme måte.

    \[\begin{aligned} \cos 3\theta &\equiv \cos (2\theta+\theta)\equiv \cos 2\theta\cos\theta-\sin 2\theta\sin\theta\\ &\equiv (\cos^2\theta-\sin^2\theta)\cos\theta-2\sin\theta\cos\theta\sin\theta\\ &\equiv \cos^3\theta-3\sin^2\theta\cos\theta\\ &\equiv \cos^3\theta-3(1-\cos^2\theta)\cos\theta\\ &\equiv 4\cos^3\theta-3\cos\theta \end{aligned}\]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: Your answer is not equivalent to \(\sin(3t)\) Svaret ditt tilsvarer ikke \(\sin(3t)\)
Your answer is equivalent to \(sin(3t)\), but you have not given it in the correct form. Svaret ditt tilsvarer \(sin(3t)\), men du har ikke gitt det i riktig form.
Your answer is not equivalent to \(\cos(3t)\) Svaret ditt tilsvarer ikke \(\cos(3t)\)
Your answer is equivalent to \(cos(3t)\), but you have not given it in the correct form. Svaret ditt tilsvarer \(cos(3t)\), men du har ikke gitt det i riktig form.

name.text: 4.3.5.5 ratio of sum of cosines and sines (NOT IN QUIZ)

questiontext.text:
Exercise

Express \(\dfrac{\cos({@b1@}x)-\cos({@a1@}x)}{\sin({@b1@}x)+\sin({@a1@}x)}\) as \(\tan(nx)\) for an integer \(n\).

\( \dfrac{\cos({@b1@}x)-\cos({@a1@}x)}{\sin({@b1@}x)+\sin({@a1@}x)}=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
We first rewrite the numerator and denominator using the sum of sines and cosines formula.

\[\begin{aligned} \cos({@b1@}x)-\cos({@a1@}x) &\equiv 2 \sin({@A1@}x)\sin({@B1@}x) \\ \sin({@b1@}x)+\sin({@a1@}x) &\equiv 2\sin({@A1@}x)\cos(-{@B1@}x) \end{aligned}\]

Using these equations we can simplify the original expression into the required form.

\[\dfrac{\cos({@b1@}x)-\cos({@a1@}x)}{\sin({@b1@}x)+\sin({@a1@}x)}\equiv \dfrac{\sin({@B1@}x)}{\cos(-{@B1@}x)}\equiv \dfrac{\sin({@B1@}x)}{\cos({@B1@}x)}\equiv \tan({@B1@}x)\]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: Your answer is not equivalent to \(\dfrac{\cos({@b1@}x)-\cos({@a1@}x)}{\sin({@b1@}x)+\sin({@a1@}x)}\)

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

What is the area \(A\) of an isosceles triangle with two equal sides of length \(x\) and apex angle \(\theta\)? Express your answer as a function of \(x\) and \(\sin \theta\). Hva er arealet \(A\) av en likebenet trekant med to like sider av lengde \(x\) og spissvinkel \(\theta\)? Uttrykk svaret ditt som en funksjon av \(x\) og \(\sin \theta\).

\(A=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

Hint: Use the following diagram. Tips: Bruk følgende diagram.

generalfeedback.text:
We first find the area of the right-angled triangle on the right. The area of the isosceles triangle will then simply be twice this area. Vi finner først arealet av den rettvinklede trekanten til høyre. Arealet av den likebenede trekanten vil da ganske enkelt være det dobbelte av dette arealet.

The area of the right-angled triangle is given by Arealet av den rettvinklede trekanten er gitt ved

\[\frac{1}{2}(CD)(AD).\]

Using the definitions of \(\sin\) and \(\cos\), we can conclude that: Ved å bruke definisjonene av \(\sin\) og \(\cos\), kan vi konkludere med at:

\[\begin{aligned} \sin\left(\frac{\theta}{2}\right) &= \frac{CD}{x} \\ \cos\left(\frac{\theta}{2}\right) &= \frac{AD}{x} \end{aligned}\]

Solving for the length of the segment we are interested in in each case gives: Å løse for lengden på segmentet vi er interessert i i hvert tilfelle gir:

\[\begin{aligned} CD &= x \sin\left(\frac{\theta}{2}\right) \\ AD &= x \cos\left(\frac{\theta}{2}\right) \end{aligned}\]

Therefore, the area of the right-angled triangle is Derfor er arealet av den rettvinklede trekanten

\[\triangle ACD = \frac{1}{2} x^2 \sin\left(\frac{\theta}{2}\right)\cos\left(\frac{\theta}{2}\right) = \frac{1}{4} x^2 \sin\theta,\]

which we rewrote using the half-angle formula. som vi skrev om ved å bruke halvvinkelformelen.

The total area of the isosceles triangle is then Det totale arealet av den likebenede trekanten er da

\[\triangle ABC = 2 \cdot \triangle ACD = \frac{1}{2} x^2 \sin\theta.\]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: Your answer can be simplified Svaret ditt kan forenkles
